TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit InputManager extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
Public NotInheritable Class InputManager Inherits DispatcherObject

Docs.summary: Manages all the input systems in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager> class is responsible for coordinating all of the input systems in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].
A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>. Filters can modify the input staging area.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager> controls the input staging area. The input staging area processes input into [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] events.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
3. The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this is in menu mode.
Docs.value: if this is in menu mode; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property returns `true` if any menus are open, and it returns `false` if no menus are open.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Components register delegates with this event to respond to a control leaving the input manager's menu mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PopMenuMode(class System.Windows.PresentationSource menuSite) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called by components to leave menu mode.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A component calls this method to leave the input manager's menu mode. The `menuSite` releases privileged access to window messages.
Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to decrement and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property to `false`, if this is the last menu to close.

Docs.summary: Occurs after the handlers have finished processing the input and the corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] events have been raised.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
3. The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.

Docs.permission: for adding or removing an event handler. Associated enumerations:

The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the starts to process the input item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>. Filters can modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventArgs.Cancel%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventArgs> passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventHandler> will cancel the processing of the input.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
3. The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.

Docs.permission: for adding or removing an event handler. Associated enumerations:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ProcessInput(class System.Windows.Input.InputEventArgs input) cil managed
Public Function ProcessInput (input As InputEventArgs) As Boolean

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Security.SecurityCritical

Docs.returns: if all input events were handled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>. Filters can modify the input staging area.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The specified input is processed by all the filters and monitors and is finally dispatched to the appropriate element as an input event.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
3. The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.

Docs.permission: for processing the specified input. Associated enumerations:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PushMenuMode(class System.Windows.PresentationSource menuSite) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called by components to enter menu mode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A component calls this method to enter the input manager's menu mode. The `menuSite` gets privileged access to window messages. Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to increment and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property to `true`, if this is the first menu to open.
